meanings.definition: To correct too much or too forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overcorrect her mistakes, making them even worse.
meanings.sent2: He always overcorrects his steering when learning to drive.
meanings.sent3: The teacher told the student not to overcorrect his spelling, as a few mistakes are okay.
meanings.sent4: Trying to overcorrect every little detail can sometimes lead to more problems.
meanings.sent5: Overcorrecting in this case will only cause confusion and frustration.

meanings.sent1: The chef had to overcorrect the seasoning in the soup, making it too salty.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes it's better to undercorrect than to overcorrect a mistake.
meanings.sent3: He decided to overcorrect his golf swing, resulting in a ball flying far off course.
meanings.sent4: Overcorrecting a painting can ruin the artist's original vision.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to overcorrect your posture, as it may lead to discomfort.
